parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular

str2: A primary particle, denoting a supposition, wish, possibility or uncertainty.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To take, receive, accept, welcome. Middle voice of a primary verb; to receive.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
And not, not even, neither?nor. From me and de; but not, not even; in a continued negation, nor.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To shake off; mid: I shake off from myself. From ek and tinasso; to shake violently.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Earth, soil, dust. From the base of cheimon; a heap, i.e. Rubbish; loose dirt.
Underneath, below, under. From hupo and kato; down under, i.e. Beneath.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From ek and poreuomai; to depart, be discharged, proceed, project.
Thence, from that place. From ekei; thence.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of martus; something evidential, i.e. evidence given or, the Decalogue.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
